body:
Our installation docs says we need Linux 2.6.23+, but that's architecture
dependent. For example, ppc64le requires a much more recent kernel, and I
remember we also require a very recent kernel for the s390x port (due to a
kernel bug exposed by Go.)

If we do document the minimum linux kernel for each architecture, it makes
sense to have a builder at that version to catch regressions. I think it's
highly unlikely that all.bash could actually pass on 2.6.23 today.
